author: Jessica Hamzelou
title: Breastfed babies have fewer viruses that affect humans in their guts
description: Early in life, babies gain billions of viruses that target gut bacteria – but breastfed babies are less likely to pick up viruses that infect human cells
content:
By Jessica Hamzelou
More benefits of breastfeeding?
Oksana Kuzmina/Alamy
A healthy set of gut bacteria seems to play a vital role in protecting us from a host of disorders but what about the billions of viruses that interact with these bacteria? Although b… [+2456 chars]
